Alan Ryan

My vote for the worst movie of 2005 goes to "War of the Worlds" - a boring, incoherent, and mawkish fantasy. Even the special effects were risible in this masterpiece of drivel. From the second I saw Tom Cruise operating a crane in the opening scene, I knew I was going to hate the film. 
 
 An unexpected pleasure which I enjoyed was "The Aviator": but Martin Scorsese seldom lets you down.
Master_Shake

Gosh, I can't remember back very far this year:) But recently, Jarhead was a dissappointment. I wouldn't say it was the worst movie of the year probably, but it certainly was dissappointing.
 
 I do have to disagree with you on War of the Worlds though. I'm not a fan of Tom Cruise, but I did really enjoy that movie.
Quetzalcoatl

War of the Worlds was alright.
 
 Flight Plan was pretty bad.
sanguinekane
The Brothers Grimm or Star Wars III. Either one really, they both sucked, hard.
Quetzalcoatl

The Brothers Grimm or Star Wars III. Either one really, they both sucked, hard.

 I had forgotten Star Wars III came out this year. That was even worse than Flight Plan. It was the only time I had to leave the theater, and I usually sit with my friends through almost any movie.
 
 Didn't see Brothers Grimm though, so I can't comment on it.
Ooaman

I have not seen many movies this year but I guess of the movies that I did see, the one I thought to be the worse was probibly War Of The Worlds (Although as I said, I didn't see many movies so if I had seen more it would have probibly been another one that was the worst.) I thought War Of The Worlds was okay but there were various little things that I just didn't like. I think it was the whole viewing expierence or something. Also, I thought so many parts were taken from other movies. I don't mean like a spoof uses items from other movies but as though the scene called for something similar to a scene in Jurassic Park or something. I like Jurassic Park but to see a movie and say that a scene in the movie "was so Steven Spielberg" suggest unoriginality. I know, it was a remake anyway, but still.
 
 I would say that the best movie was either Fantastic 4 because I enjoy super hero movies or Hitchhicker's Guide To The Galaxy because it was finally a movie based off of a book that I actually had read.
 
An unexpected pleasure which I enjoyed was "The Aviator": but Martin Scorsese seldom lets you down.

 Were you refering to this year for this one? Because "The Aviator" came out last year. Otherwise, it would not have been able to be up for any Oscars last year.
zachvac

The Brothers Grimm or Star Wars III. Either one really, they both sucked, hard.

 
 
 What was wrong with Star Wars III? I thought it was good. I just wish they'd do the last 3 as promised, but it's not looking like it.
Master_Shake
I really liked Episode 3. At any rate, one I just remembered was Red Eye. Red Eye, oh my, it was bad.
sanguinekane

What was wrong with Star Wars III? 

 
 The acting was horrible, the plot was full of holes (though I love the Star Wars story), gratuitous use of bad CGI, the cinematography was unimaginative, and the end...shudder.
Big_Bear_Scot

The acting was horrible, the plot was full of holes (though I love the Star Wars story), gratuitous use of bad CGI, the cinematography was unimaginative, and the end...shudder.

 
 Puts on James Earl Jones voice
 
 "NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO"
 
 :)
Alan Ryan

Were you refering to this year for this one? Because "The Aviator" came out last year. Otherwise, it would not have been able to be up for any Oscars last year.

 I might be wrong but I don't think it was released in the UK until early this year. In any case, I bought the DVD about three months ago because I'm a Scorsese fan.
Phunting

IMDB lists 'The Aviator' as 2004.
 
 I didn't watch war of the worlds as I knew I'd hate it. I must admit I don't often go to see a film unless I'm fairly sure I'll like it, so I don't know...
Tastyfish

I had forgotten Star Wars III came out this year. That was even worse than Flight Plan. It was the only time I had to leave the theater, and I usually sit with my friends through almost any movie.
 
 Didn't see Brothers Grimm though, so I can't comment on it.

 You watched Episodes I and II presumably, yet walked on III?
 
 Saw II was the worst I went to see, just plain silly and suffered too much from psychic villain syndrome. Didn't even dare to go and see Fantastic 4 though
Ooaman

I thought of another one...
 Now, while I do enjoy the Bat Man movies, and wouldn't really say Bat Man Begins was the worst, I would say that it was hard to follow for the first 30-45 minutes because to me, it kept going back and forth and I never knew when each separate scene was taking place. It seemed to jump around too much. But at least it did follow with the other Bat Man movies by having someone different play Bat Man and had a big name person play the main villain. (Although, I did not recognize the guy who played Scare Crow.)
Quetzalcoatl

You watched Episodes I and II presumably, yet walked on III?
 
 Saw II was the worst I went to see, just plain silly and suffered too much from psychic villain syndrome. Didn't even dare to go and see Fantastic 4 though

 I was in elementary and middle school when I watched them, so I was only mildly irritated by the dialogue.
 
 When I went to watch Episode III, I was already irritated by memories of the first two, (minus the random, enjoyable Yoda fight scene) so I decided not to finish watching it. I was with friends, none of whom enjoyed it either. It seems like it was made for a younger audience than it was marketed towards.
 
 I wasn't much of a fan of Saw II either. A lot of my friends liked it, but I found the "gore" rather boring, and the whole idea behind him not really being a killer was incorrect, considering he actively poisoned them/put them in traps/etc. It would be equivalent to me going up to someone with a gun, saying "defend yourself" and shooting the person in the face, except that would be slightly more obvious to those who were watching.
Master_Shake
Batman Begins was probably the best of the bunch, at least on par with the first. I didn't even bother seeing Saw 2 seeing as the first one was so god awful.
Quetzalcoatl

I didn't even bother seeing Saw 2 seeing as the first one was so god awful.

 I had only watched the first one earlier in the day in order to understand what would be happening in the second one. Saw II was even worse than the first.
 
 Now I just sound like I hate everything though. I enjoyed Batman Begins and Unleashed.
Ooaman

Batman Begins was probably the best of the bunch...

 I thought the movie as a whole was good. I just had trouble with all the jumping around in the first 30-45 minutes. To jump around from scene to scene is one thing. But it seemed to jump around from time to time. It was like, first he was in prision, then he was a kid. Then he tried to kill the man who shot his parents and then he was released from prison and started training. The first half hour (+) seemed to lack continuity. Then when he came back and started to become Bat Man and actually became Bat Man, it made more sence and followed the timeline more acurately. (Except for that fact that the first movie hinted or played around with the idea that it was the Joker who killed Bruce's parents.)

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Worst movie of 2005
